subject: statistics
title: Sampling Distribution of the Mean
contentHtml: In this worked example, we'll explore how to find the mean and variance of a sampling distribution.
name: Sample Mean Formula" },
statementHtml:
Suppose we have a population with mean μ and standard deviation σ. We take a random sample of size n from this population and calculate the sample mean \(\bar{x}\). Find the mean and variance of the sampling distribution of \(\bar{x}\).

",
hints: Hint: Use the central limit theorem
solutionHtml:
We know that the sampling distribution of \(\bar{x}\) is approximately normal with mean μ and standard deviation σ/√n.

The mean of this distribution is simply μ, since we're averaging many samples.

",
problemHtml:
Suppose our population has a mean of 10 and standard deviation of 3. We take a random sample of size 25 from this population and calculate the sample mean \(\bar{x}\). Find the mean and variance of the sampling distribution of \(\bar{x}\).

",
steps: [ {"stepNumber": 1, "description": "Recognize that we're dealing with a sampling distribution", "mathHtml": "\(X\bar{x} = \frac{1}{n}\sum_{i=1}^n X_i\)", "explanation": "We can apply the central limit theorem to find the mean and variance of this distribution."}, {"stepNumber": 2, "description": "Use the central limit theorem", "mathHtml": "\(X\bar{x} \sim N(\mu, (\sigma/\sqrt{n})^2)\)", "explanation": "This tells us that our sampling distribution is approximately normal with mean μ and variance (σ/√n)^2."}, {"stepNumber": 3, "description": "Find the mean of this distribution", "mathHtml": "\(E[\bar{x}] = \mu\)", "explanation": "The mean of our sampling distribution is simply the population mean μ."}, {"stepNumber": 4, "description": "Find the variance of this distribution", "mathHtml": "\(Var[\bar{x}] = (\sigma/\sqrt{n})^2\)", "explanation": "The variance of our sampling distribution is (σ/√n)^2."} ],
intuition: Understanding the mean and variance of a sampling distribution is crucial in statistical inference. This concept has direct applications in machine learning, where we often use sample means to make predictions or estimate population parameters.

subject: statistics
title: Sampling Distribution of the Mean
contentHtml: In this worked example, we'll explore how to find the mean and variance of the sample mean X̄.
name: Sample Mean Formula" },
statementHtml: Suppose we have a population with mean μ and standard deviation σ. We take a random sample of size n from this population and calculate the sample mean X̄.
hints: Hint: Think about the distribution of X̄
solutionHtml:
We want to find the mean and variance of X̄.

  • Step 1: Find the expected value of X̄. Since X̄ is an average, its expected value is μ.
  • Step 2: Calculate the variance of X̄. We can do this by finding the variance of each individual data point and then taking the average.
  • Step 3: Use the formula for the variance of a sample mean to find the variance of X̄.
problemHtml: Suppose we have a population with mean 10 and standard deviation 3. We take a random sample of size 25 from this population.
steps: [ {"stepNumber": 1, "description": "Find the expected value of X̄", "mathHtml": "\(X\overline{x} = \frac{1}{n}\sum_{i=1}^n x_i = \mu = 10\)", "explanation": "Since X̄ is an average, its expected value is the population mean."}, {"stepNumber": 2, "description": "Calculate the variance of X̄", "mathHtml": "\(V(X\overline{x}) = V(\frac{1}{n}\sum_{i=1}^n x_i) = \frac{\sigma^2}{n}\)", "explanation": "We can do this by finding the variance of each individual data point and then taking the average."}, {"stepNumber": 3, "description": "Use the formula for the variance of a sample mean", "mathHtml": "\(V(X\overline{x}) = \frac{\sigma^2}{n}\)", "explanation": "This is the final answer."} ],
intuition: The sampling distribution of the mean is a normal distribution with mean μ and standard error \(\frac{\sigma}{\sqrt{n}}\).",
visualDescription: A diagram showing the sampling distribution of the mean, highlighting its shape and parameters.
commonMistakes: Forgetting to account for the sample size in the variance calculation
realWorldApplications: Estimating population means in machine learning models
